t: Create PO, Questionary, and Roadmap agent definitions
mh: PO Agent manages vision, requirements, scope decisions
Questionary handles structured scope clarification (capped 3 rounds)
Roadmap Agent produces valid phase dependency graph
No agent directly contacts user (Owner-first proxy preserved)
obj: Define the three new agents for the Product Ownership layer: yolo-po (Product Owner), yolo-questionary (scope clarification), and yolo-roadmap (dependency and roadmap planning). Each agent file is self-contained with no shared file modifications.

a: Create agents/yolo-po.md with YAML frontmatter (name: yolo-po, description: Product Owner agent managing vision, requirements, scope decisions, and PO-Questionary loop orchestration, tools: Read/Glob/Grep/Write, disallowedTools: Edit/Bash/EnterPlanMode/ExitPlanMode, model: opus, maxTurns: 30, permissionMode: plan, memory: project). Agent body defines: (1) Hierarchy: reports to go.md (Owner proxy), directs Questionary Agent and receives enriched scope; (2) Persona & Voice: Product Owner / VP Product archetype with vision-first vocabulary, strategic scope framing, requirement prioritization language; (3) Core Protocol with 4 modes: Mode 0 (Scope Gathering) produces structured scope document via Questionary loop, Mode 1 (Requirements Review) validates requirements against vision, Mode 2 (Scope Change Assessment) evaluates mid-phase scope changes, Mode 3 (Vision Sign-off) final scope approval before Tech Lead dispatch; (4) Communication section defining user_presentation output type schema: {type: user_presentation, content: string, options: string[], context: string} — this is NOT direct user contact, orchestrator renders it via AskUserQuestion; (5) Effort-Based Behavior table: turbo=skip PO, fast=single-round scope, balanced=full PO-Questionary loop, thorough=deep scope with multiple stakeholder perspectives; (6) Constraints section: PO never contacts user directly, all user interaction via user_presentation rendered by orchestrator.
v: File exists, has valid YAML frontmatter with model: opus, body contains user_presentation output type and Mode 0-3 sections

a: Create agents/yolo-questionary.md with YAML frontmatter (name: yolo-questionary, description: Scope clarification agent that engages in structured dialogue with PO to resolve ambiguity and produce enriched scope documents, tools: Read/Glob/Grep, disallowedTools: Write/Edit/Bash/EnterPlanMode/ExitPlanMode, model: sonnet, maxTurns: 15, permissionMode: plan, memory: project). Agent body defines: (1) Hierarchy: reports to PO Agent only; (2) Persona & Voice: Business Analyst / Requirements Engineer archetype; (3) Input Contract: receives PO scope draft JSON, project context, prior phase summaries; (4) Output Contract: returns scope_clarification JSON: {round, questions: [{id, category, question, context, options}], resolved: [{id, resolution}], scope_confidence: 0.0-1.0, enriched_scope: {} when confidence >= threshold}; (5) Round Protocol: Round 1 — identify ambiguities and missing requirements, Round 2 — deep-dive unresolved items and propose defaults, Round 3 — final resolution with stated assumptions; (6) Early Exit: scope_confidence >= 0.85 after any round skips remaining rounds; (7) Constraints: read-only, no user contact, max 3 rounds hard cap.
v: File exists, has valid YAML frontmatter with model: sonnet, body contains Round Protocol and scope_confidence field

a: Create agents/yolo-roadmap.md with YAML frontmatter (name: yolo-roadmap, description: Dependency and Roadmap agent that analyzes requirements to produce phase ordering, dependency graphs, and milestone plans, tools: Read/Glob/Grep/Write, disallowedTools: Edit/Bash/EnterPlanMode/ExitPlanMode, model: sonnet, maxTurns: 15, permissionMode: plan, memory: project). Agent body defines: (1) Hierarchy: reports to PO Agent; (2) Persona & Voice: Program Manager / Release Planner archetype; (3) Input Contract: enriched scope document from PO-Questionary output, existing ROADMAP.md, prior summaries, codebase mapping; (4) Output Contract: roadmap_plan JSON with phases array, dependency_graph (adjacency list), critical_path (ordered phase IDs), milestones array; (5) Planning Protocol: extract feature groups, identify dependencies, topological sort, validate no cycles, assign complexity, identify critical path; (6) Constraints: no user contact, produces dependency_graph for validate-deps.sh.
v: File exists, has valid YAML frontmatter with model: sonnet, body contains dependency_graph and critical_path in Output Contract
